alert.note: Alert for Beaver (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 8:21PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Beaver County through 845 PM CDT... At 821 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Knowles, or 14 miles northeast of Beaver, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beaver, Forgan, Gate, Knowles and Mocane. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Oklahoma.
